bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, January 8, 1952

div1.p: The Hench's will be in Havana in January for a conference, and hope to see her while they are there.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, January 8, 1952
div1.opener:
January 8, 1952
Senora E. Agramonte de Rodriguez Leon
Calle K No. 254
Vedado, Havana
Cuba
Senor Francisco
Tel F-4954
My dear Senora:
div1.p:
Mrs. Hench and I appreciate so much your nice
Christmas greeting.

I have been meaning to write to you as Mrs. Hench
and I are going to be in Havana at the Hotel
Nacional attending a medical conference between
January 21 and 26. I do hope that we have a
chance to see you and your good husband. I am
somewhat concerned because I had hoped to be
able to have a nice rest in Havana and parti-
cipate only in the activities of one day, but
now I am receiving certain invitations to medical
luncheons, dinners, etc., and hope that these
will not prevent us from seeing our very good
“yellow fever friends.”
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosure
P.S.: You say you have heard that I was to re-
ceive the Finlay Medal. I think that you are
mistaken, at least I have heard nothing about
that. There have been a number of American
doctors who have visited Cuba recently who have
received the medal. I have read about this in
the Journal of the American Medical Association.
